string.text: Come here, don't be shy!
Come here, stalker! Take your pick!
Take your pick from my goods, stalker!
Oh, you're back! What've you got? Brought the cash?
Hi there. Haven't seen you here before — got anything to share?
See you.
Until next time.
Bye.
Got any info to trade?
Come on in, stalker! Take your pick! Or do have something you want to unload and sell?
I'm looking for a stalker named Chord. You know him?
'Course I know the guy — he's in debt to me! I happen to be looking for him myself. He borrowed three ammo boxes from me and went off to god knows where!
I see we're rowing in the same direction. Tell me where I can find him, and I'll be your loan shark.

Alright then, let's give it a shot! He and his group made a small shelter here in the vicinity. Once you exit the village, cross the road and you'll see a wagon. That's where they might be. Go on, and give his ass a friendly reminder about his debt!
Roger that!
Why, hello, detective! I'm surprised you found the trail so quickly.
Is that you? You're one of those who were seen at the science facility...
Correct. Ever so diligently did you seek me, and here I am before you. What do you next?
Where's the professor?
The professor? Somewhere much better than in that sleazy joint of yours! You too had better choose the right side while you still have the chance.
The right side? You're a murderer! You killed people in this camp and the stalker at the Cordon. And the professor... you kidnapped him, didn't you?
Kidnapped? Ha-ha! He scurried away from you at the speed of light. He knew how thankless it is to be working for the government.
Who are you people?
How are you doing, commander?
Don't you "commander" me. We never finished our conversation. Who are you, and where's professor Dubinin?
Explaining that would take too long for my liking, so let's put that aside while the bastards behind this are still breathing. You still need your things, don't you?
What are you suggesting?
We go find the assholes and throw a little reunion party. Come on, move your legs.
You're in my sights, just so you know.
I'm afraid he's not coming back. Chord and his group are dead.
I was in Chord's camp. It would seem you know him... or, rather, *knew* him. Chord and his group are dead.
Damn it!
They killed them. Quick and silent. They had no idea what was coming.
Why would they do that? What a pity about the boys... They helped me carry out my work and bring in loot. Shit, may they rest in peace with all the artifacts in the Zone...
Just so happens I don't know jack about these parts. What's with those mercs nearby? They sure got some nerve.
Ah, yeah, the mercs... You said it, they've got quite a pair! Here, you see my hand? Me neither! That's their doing, those bastards!
Really? What happened?

They came up to me some time ago to check my goods, and we had some disagreements on the price. They thought I was gonna cheat 'em! But I have nothing to hide, my business is fair and square... Then I see they have no shortage of cash, so I throw on another couple of grand. Then, all of a sudden, they pin down my hand and chop! Now they have it hanging in their camp like a souvenir...
Have you heard about their "games"?

Yup, I've heard all there is to know. For your information, they were quick to tell me that more of my body parts would be hanging in their camp if I tell anyone. Ah, shoot, I've already told you enough as it is...
Don't fret. You won't be seeing them in the camp anymore. They picked the wrong man to play with.
You're kidding? Well, I'll be! You made this old trader happy! It's no good thing getting your spirits up after people die, but it'd be a shame not to raise a drink to that! What do you say?
That'd sure hit the spot.
Also, what did you want from Chord's group? Aren't you the one who did them in?
Me? No way. Do I look like a terminator to you?
Then what happened to them?
They were killed by the people I came here for in the first place. Haven't you seen groups of people armed to the teeth in these areas? Their uniforms are like nothing on this earth.
I haven't seen them personally, but the locals have been talking about it. Then again, you see all kinds of people around here. What did Chord do to get on their bad side?
They're in hiding, and Chord saw them and reported it. Shame he paid for it with his life. Where could they be? Maybe they've broken camp somewhere?

Here? Doubt it. You have Freedom on the Barrier, the warehouses have been abandoned for who knows how long and the village is inhabited by bloodsuckers. You don't really have more secluded places than that. They're not from around here, that's for sure.
What's up with the warehouses? Freedom used to have their base there, didn't they?

They consolidated their forces on the Barrier, and that's where all of them have hunkered down. Regarding the warehouses, something really strange started appearing there. I don't know myself, but stalkers do their best to steer clear of that place. First of all, they have no business there, and second, folks have been seeing things there... ghosts or phantoms or whatever. Might be a controller — who knows.
Alright, thanks for the info!
Hold up a second. Who are *you*? What business do you have with those soldier boys?
Just a guy with a job. On a mission to find them, and I aim to complete it.
I see... a freelancer. Well, if you're looking for more work in my shop, just let me know. Your abilities would be very appreciated.
Noted. But first I need finish my own business. Got any place I could doze off? I'm dead on my feet right now.
No problem at all. There are a couple of spots here in the village where you can lay down. The sentries will keep you guarded.
Thanks!
How are you feeling? You look tired.
It's nothing, I'm fine. Did you have any trouble on the way here?
Everything went all right. We decided to avoid the Bar, though. So this means you've been all the talk on the stalker network? Shame about Koval.
Without him, my dead body would've been all the talk and we likely wouldn't have tracked down the professor.
What'd you find out?

Not a whole lot. They killed the stalker that worked unofficially with the professor. He must've either known something important or crossed them. A few hours back, I had the opportunity of meeting with one of those people, and he told me we're better off giving up... or we'll end up just like him.
And what are your thoughts?
Our mission is to find professor Dubinin. We don't know who's threatening us or what their numbers are, nor do we know whether their threats are credible, but our objective stands.
What do we know about Dubinin? Was he abducted?
I highly doubt that. There's the chance that he left the facility willingly. We just have to find out why...
What's the plan?
We're close to our targets. We just have to find the area where they might've set up camp.

I might just know how. They must have some radio frequency. I have equipment that might let us eavesdrop on them — just gotta find the right signal and track down its source. Though, we do need to find a high point to maximize the radius.
There's an abandoned military base not far from here. Inside are watchtowers. Will that do?
Worth a shot. Are we moving out?

We're moving out, but be careful there. Not that long ago, the warehouses were held by fighters from Freedom, but they left the base in a hurry. Not only that, but the local stalkers also do their best to stay away. There's something not right there, so stay alert.
Phew. Looks like we made it through!
We need to hurry up before those ghosts give us more than we bargained for.
This device right here needs to be placed on a tower. I'll pick up the signal from below while our boys cover us, okay?
Sounds like a plan.
We made it!
Thank god. Any news? I heard some numbers while I was on the tower.

The device did manage to intercept a few signals! Some of them obviously belong to the locals, but one of them — a really strong one — is being transmitted through an encrypted channel. Its source is somewhere around the crashed helicopter close to the trader's village.
So there is use in going there! What about the numbers in the radio signals? Can we crack their meaning?
I don't know yet. Seems like a numbers station — I have some experience with it from when I was a student. It'll definitely take me some time.
Alright, we'll save it for later. Let's move out.
Here it is. There's enough psy-emissions here to give brain damage to my dead grandfather!
I see something in the helicopter. Looks like a well covered-up entrance.
Definitely. But our devices are going haywire from psy-emissions, so there's no way we're getting there. A few more steps toward that chopper and our brains are mush.
Any ideas?
Well, we're sure as hell not getting anywhere near there... at least without special protection.
Maybe Bison, the trader, can give us a hint, since he lives right next to that place. To the village!
Hi there. I'm in urgent need of information.
Oh, you again! Any luck with the needle in your haystack?
That needle's not as tiny as you might think. As for the haystack, I hoped you might help me find out more about it.

I'd rather not lose my other hand if I open my mouth about that. These people killed Chord and his group, and this is far from their first day in the Zone. No chance I'm risking my life by playing your games — I'm just a trader.

If you're just a trader, why are you selling supplies in the Zone instead of selling melons on the market? You're undocumented, just like many others here. Provide me assistance and you can trade here as much as you want — the military won't harm a hair on your head.
I knew it — you're with the army! Anyone could tell from a mile away. Should I be scared of you? I'm all set up — I knew who to pay for you to look the other way.
Whoever you paid, I can guarantee you that refusing to cooperate with me will revoke all agreements. Everything you tell me stays between us.
So what is it you're after?
The helicopter near the village. What do you know about it?
Just a regular helicopter that crashed to the ground. It's been there for ages. And don't even think about going there, or your head might just turn into a tea maker.
Have any stalkers tried getting close to it?
Why would they? The less clever ones here are culled way down at the Cordon or the Garbage. The ones who've made it this far have the brains not to wander into a psy-source.
We need to examine that area. Maybe the emissions subside from time to time?
Never heard about anything like that.
Well, do you at least have any ideas? You'll get a fair compensation, hustler.

Got no ideas, but I'll tell you about someone who's real interested in things like that. He's handy and a real brainiac, but boy, is he easily offended! He used to hang out with us in the village, fixing up equipment and electronics for the stalkers. After that, we had a little falling out, and now he exiled himself from our community. How about this: I'll give you his PDA ID number, and you convince him to return to the village. Tell him I'm ready to make an agreeable deal. Sound good?
Sounds good.
We have a deal, then! The ID number is in your PDA. Good luck!
Thanks. I'm off.
What's new?
There's a man we need to find who will help us reach the helicopter. I have the his PDA's ID number. Can you track him down?
Sure thing. Give it here.

Excellent. Here's what we'll do: you stay in the village and try to decrypt the signals. If you intercept anything else, radio me. Vuslych will stay with you while Hottab heads off to watch over the helicopter — we need to keep track of any movements around it.
What about you? Are you heading out alone?
Having our entire squad move around the area is too risky. We've made enough noise already, and soon everyone will know we're here. That's why I'll go by myself.
Alright. I'm picking up his PDA signal. It's in the abandoned village across the road... the same one locals say is infested with bloodsuckers! You sure you'll be fine?
I'll be fine. What matters is finding that stalker in one piece. I better get moving.
At least someone's alive!
What are you doing there?
Yeah, see, I climbed down this basement to clear it of loot! Kidding. I got stuck here while running from a bloodsucker!
Alright. Sit tight while I deal with the bloodsuckers, or they'll give me a hard time getting you back up. I need to think of something.
You done with the bloodsuckers yet?
Did ya get 'em? The bloodsuckers?
Are the bloodsuckers dead?
Not yet. Wait a bit.
Not all of them. Wait.
Not yet. Sit tight just a bit longer.
Finally, another soul around here!
What are you doing there?
Yeah, see, I climbed down this basement to clear it of loot! Kidding. I got stuck here while running from a bloodsucker!
Just how do I get you out of there...?
So, did you kill those monsters?
Looks like I did. How am I getting you out of there?
Where's the ladder, my friend?
I'm already starting to feel off, man. Bring the ladder!
Where's the ladder, stalker? Please, get me out of here!
Don't worry. I'm about to get it.
Calm down. I'll find it.
Don't panic. I'll find you the ladder now.
Finally, give it here!
Step back. I'm dropping it.
Thanks, stalker! I thought I was done for without food in there. Rarely does anyone walk into this village.
What brought *you* here?
You see that? See the light that's shining, the fridge that's running, the radio that's sizzling?
Hard not to notice! There's a light flashing over the whole village.
Exactly, and I'm here to find out how. That equipment's been laying around here for who knows how long, and it recently started operating all of a sudden.
With all the bloodsuckers here, this isn't quite the place for science experiments! One of them seemed to conduct electricity.
Yup, that's the one I was running from when I went into the house. Is it safe outside? Did you get 'em all?
I dispatched some of them, but I'm sure there's more nearby.
I saw a sparkling transformer in the yard, and I think that's what's generating the energy. Will you help me get through to it? I'll make it worth your while!
What's your name?
Marmot.
Alright, Marmot, you've convinced me. Lead on.
Now that was really something! Ever seen anything like that?
I sure haven't. This artifact powered all the electronics in the village?
As you saw yourself, everything went dark when I brought it out. Now I won't be having any electricity problems in my shack!
You have a shack?
'Course I do! I'm not staying around on the farm with that swindler!
You mean the trader?

That's right. So, let's get out of here, huh? The locals are gonna get suspicious about the power going out again... Let's head over to my place, 'cause your gear is just screaming for repairs. Let's call that my token of appreciation!
You're right about that. Let's go.
And here we are!
What were you thinking making shelter here of all places?
What? It's a good spot! Sure, the marsh is stinky and all, but there are plenty of mines around to keep the mutants away.
Aren't you afraid of other stalkers?
On the contrary: nobody goes snooping around here. They're afraid of what's started happening in the military base.
And you *aren't* afraid?

I never even go there. Sometimes, I'm tempted to... There must be all kinds of useful stuff there after the military and Freedom left, but just the thought of going there gives me the creeps! Anyway, who are you? I haven't seen you here before.
I'm a stalker. Sparrow's the name.
You don't really look like a stalker.
How come?
Any stalker would've had their eyes lit up after seeing the artifact we found in the village, but you don't even seem to care!

I'm here on other business. I need to get inside the cabin of the helicopter that crashed not far from here, but there are psy-emissions there. There's no way through, and I have no idea how to get past them.
And here I thought you came across me in the village by sheer chance. What, were you looking for me?
What are you, a mind-reader? Can't hide anything from you!
No, it's just that this all seems a bit too convenient. I needed your help, you needed mine.
Well, I just helped you. Will you help me now?
What's your business with that helicopter, anyway?
I need to find the black box that was inside.
Hah. And what black box is that? That helicopter crashed here in the past century. It's long since been dismantled.
To me, it's worth the risk. Will you help?
You need protection. I can make it — even have some experience.
Yeah? From where?
Back when the Scorcher was still operational, stalkers used to come to me. We'd assemble these special helmets to break through to Pripyat.
Did it work?
No. They died near the Radar.
That's very encouraging.
They died, but they made it a lot further than anyone without protection. The psy-emissions around the helicopter aren't that strong, so it might just be enough. There's just one thing...
What's that?
My resources are finite. For me to assemble a helmet again, I'll need spare parts... and right now, I'm all out of those.
Where can we find them?
Technically, we can find them some three hundred meters away from us.
The military base?
Bingo! I've had my eyes on it for a long time, but I've been dreading going there alone, and no one's wanted to keep me company.
I take it you have a special interest in it?

Of course I do: think about all the useful toys you could find in their warehouse. I also need something to help me climb the stalker ladder. Gotta fix up the house in the marsh, plant a few more mines around the edges, set up a strong signal... The only place where I can find all of that is the military base.
So, we're heading in the same direction. But I'd rather carry out the search ASAP.
We could head out right now.
Great. Let's move!
That phantom seems miserable without his drink. C'mon, give him a bottle and something might just happen.
I'll give it a shot.
Everything clear? That phantom in front of the warehouse is making my skin crawl...
Clear. What've you got?
I think the materials we found will be enough to assemble a helm.
Just one helm?
Just one. What, you need more?
That would come in very handy.
If you know of any other haunted military base in the vicinity, let me know and we'll go there together. Then we'll make another pair of helmets!
Fine, one's enough... Now let's get the hell out of here.
Pretty sure my hands remember what to do. I'll try to assemble it now...
Will it take long?
Where are you hurrying off to? Your helicopter's not going anywhere, don't worry about it!
Still.
About an hour. I've made five pieces like this before. Got the schematics — the rest is just technique.
You sure it'll work? I'd rather not have my brains scorched like your other pals.
Hey, now you're just hurting my feelings! Do you think I'd let down the man who saved me? By the way, thanks again for that!
Likewise. How did you get into tech work?

When I came to the Zone, I didn't know a wrench from a screwdriver. After that, I met a man in the swamps. Back then, I went there with a few stalkers to go looking for artifacts, and we all ended up in some trouble.
You sure talking won't distract you?
Nah. I like having a conversation.
If you say so. You went to the swamps, then what?

Well, at that point, our backpacks were stuffed with artifacts. I mean, the Swamps aren't as well-charted as the Cordon, so we were real lucky to get the good stuff.
 
We were walking, silence all around. Then our PDAs blow up with messages that an emission's coming! We looked around — spotted some abandoned farm, then made our way there to wait out the emission. We almost made it, but then something came out storming from the reeds... a pack of some thirty boars, swept us like a damn tidal wave! We opened fire on them, but you can imagine it was as good as useless. I have no idea how many of those hogs stampeded over me, but I was down on the ground and couldn't feel a thing, and then I passed out.
 
When I woke up, I was in a bed. Legs, hands, ribs — everything was broken, my whole body was aching all over, bruises from head to toe. Just breathing hurt. I later found out I was saved by one of the local stalkers, who lived alone on the edge of the swamps.
The Swamp Doctor?

I thought the same when I came to, but no. He introduced himself as Ivan, though something tells me that's not his real name. Said he found me half-dead on the bank of the swamp. Brought me to his camp, patched up my wounds, and splinted my fractures. He tells me, "You'll have to lay here for a month, whether that's to your liking or not."
What about the rest?
Nothing and no one around. The others were gone, my backpack with the loot was gone... Even my weapons were gone. They left me there at the Zone's mercy.
Some real friends you had there.
They were never my friends. We met in the village and agreed to go after loot together, nothing more.
But they must've had some humanity in them. Just leaving you in the swamps to die, that's...

While I was recovering, I thought about that too. Every day I thought, "Soon as I'm on my feet, I'm gonna find them and fill them with lead!" But Ivan knocked some sense into me. Told me that, when he found me, I looked like fresh kill... not to mention the emission was getting closer every second. Had they tried to save me, we'd all be goners. Point is, Ivan taught me a lot of things, like cleaning your weapon or patching up your suit, even taught me a thing or two about radio electronics. Everything I know? It's thanks to Ivan. I didn't spend one month in that camp, as he initially thought, but ten... but for one man to teach me so much was by far worth the wounds I received.
What happened after that?

After that, I went back to the Cordon, to live the normal stalker life again. A couple of months after that, I wanted to pay Ivan a visit, bring him some vodka and snacks, give him a proper thank you... but, when I arrived, his home was empty. He left. I never managed to see him again. I hope he's alive and well. If it wasn't for him, you and I wouldn't be having this conversation.
How did you end up near the warehouses, then?

The local trader, Bison, decided to open up shop here. He invited me over and told me, "I'll give you a few percentages if you help fix stalkers' equipment." He pretty much wanted to have his own little Bar, but way up north in the Zone, for stalkers to fix their things and buy supplies. Not long after, though, it's like he went off the handle: he used to be quite generous with money, but eventually went as far as to demand it from me. "Don't go making a business out of your repairs. You're leaving me with nothing!" I said, "screw this," and left them.
That's fair. He did ask me to talk to you about returning.
Oh, so you know him? You can tell him there's no way I'm going back there!
He promised to work with you on mutually beneficial terms.
I'm fine right where I am.
But you're all alone here. There are stalkers in the camp to help you if anything happens.

See, that's why I went to the warehouses: I found a few mines there. Tomorrow I'm setting it all up, and nobody's getting on my property without my consent. Only after that will I tell the stalkers I can fix their equipment. There will always be a client in these parts.
Suit yourself. How's it going with the assembly?
Just a little more! Who are you, anyway? I must've bored you out of your mind going on about myself.
Not at all. I'll tell you if you promise to keep your lips sealed.
I'm no snitch. Don't worry your head about it.
I'm a military stalker. I'm on a mission here.
Hold up... You're a soldier?!
Not quite. A military stalker, just like any other stalker, but on more formal footing. Don't worry, my responsibilities don't include searching and capturing undocumented stalkers.
So what is it that you do?

Ordinary soldiers rarely venture beyond the Cordon or science facilities, and that's where we come in. I must say, you seem like quite the clever fellow — just the type of man we need. Think about it: the salary's handsome. You'll get to do your thing while being out of harm's way.
Hm. I appreciate the offer, but...
Whatever the case, nice to meet you. I hope we'll see each other again.
I hope so too. Now, here's what you've been waiting for — take it!
Does it work?

It works! Just keep in mind that the helm heats up rapidly, so don't spend too much time inside the psy-emissions. If you start feeling a headache, get out of there in an instant. I'm no master at my craft, but it should give you the time you need to figure out what's what about the helicopter cabin.
Thanks. Time for me to go. Stay safe, Marmot!
Any news?
A local craftsman assembled a psy-helm for me. I need to climb down while they're still there and end this once and for all.
Just one? What about us? Going there alone is suicide. We don't even know their numbers!

Do we have a choice? You heard everything yourself. They already know we're here, and they're already preparing to cut and run. It's now or never. You stay here, watch the area, and keep me in touch if you manage to intercept any more talks.
Well, alright... Are you really sure about this?
Yes. I didn't wait months for a real mission only to back out in the last moment.
Just don't get yourself killed if you start smelling something burning. If they leave, we'll track 'em down again. Just make sure you don't get your ass shot to hell!
Look who's talking. Who was it that wanted to continue when we stormed the power plant, in spite of my orders?
Hah. Back then, I was the one listening to you... and now I'm asking you to listen to me. If you feel outgunned, pull back.
I won't go Rambo, but you and the other men are to keep your eyes open. I was attacked several hours ago, and they could show up here too. We'll talk later!
Glad to see you!
Hey there!
Go on. What've you got?
Glad to see you!
Let's hear it, stalker!
I'm listening, friend.
Bye.
I'm going.
'Til next time.
